Beginner Sewing Class

Have you always wanted to learn how to sew but didn’t know where to start? This friendly, hands-on workshop is the perfect introduction. You’ll be guided step-by-step through the process of sewing your very first project: a simple and stylish tote bag.

No prior sewing experience is required—just bring your curiosity and creativity! You’ll learn how to thread and operate a sewing machine, understand fabric types, cut from a simple pattern, and finish your bag with neat seams and straps. Along the way, you'll also pick up essential sewing vocabulary and techniques that will set you up for future projects.

This is more than just a class—it’s a confidence boost and a creative kickstart in a supportive, fun atmosphere. Walk in as a beginner, and walk out with a finished bag and new skills that you can build on.

Included:

  • All materials (fabric, thread, and pattern)

  • Use of sewing machine and tools

  • Small-group instruction (max 6 people)

  • Light refreshments

Perfect for: Adults and teens 14+, beginners, gift-givers, creative explorers

Duration: 2.5 hours

Price: €40 (or included in membership/pass)

Let your kids dive into the colorful world of sewing with this fun and age-appropriate workshop designed especially for children aged 8 to 12. In this class, young makers will learn how to safely use a sewing machine and complete simple sewing projects they can take home—like a pencil pouch, mini plush toy, or headband.

This class focuses on creativity, confidence, and motor skills. Through sewing, kids practice patience, following instructions, and problem-solving—all while having a blast. The workshop is led by a warm and experienced instructor who loves working with children and sparking their creative potential.

We provide all kid-safe materials and machines, and there's plenty of support and encouragement in a non-competitive setting. Whether it’s their first time sewing or they’ve dabbled before, your child will leave proud of what they’ve made.

Included:

  • Use of safe, kid-friendly sewing machines

  • Colorful fabric and all needed materials

  • Step-by-step guidance and supervision

  • Take-home creations!

Perfect for: Creative kids aged 8–12, no experience needed

Duration: 1.5 hours

Price: €25 (or included in membership/pass)

Ready to give your old clothes a new life? This workshop is for makers who already know how to use a sewing machine and want to take their creativity—and sustainability—to the next level. Bring in a few pieces from your closet that you’re ready to refresh or reinvent, and we’ll guide you through the process of transforming them into something new and wearable.

We’ll cover techniques like hemming, patchwork, decorative stitching, resizing, and adding new elements like zippers, pockets, or panels. This is a great opportunity to experiment with design, get advice on fit and repair, and work in a creative community of fellow upcyclers.

The goal is not perfection—it’s expression, exploration, and extending the life of your clothing. Whether you're turning a shirt into a bag, jeans into a skirt, or simply repairing and embellishing, you’ll leave with reimagined clothes you can actually wear.

Included:

  • Access to sewing machines, tools, and shared materials

  • Tips on fashion upcycling, alterations, and design

  • Guidance from a sustainability-conscious instructor

  • Coffee/tea and music to keep the vibes flowing

Please Bring:

  • 1 to 3 garments you’d like to work on

  • Any trims or embellishments you’d like to add (optional)

Perfect for: Adults and teens with basic sewing machine experience

Duration: 2.5 hours

Price: €40 (or included in membership/pass)
